extendedIngredients.name: canned black beans
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 (15 ounce) cans black beans, drained and rinsed

extendedIngredients.name: ground flax seed
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 tablespoons ground flax seed + 3 tablespoons water

extendedIngredients.name: harissa
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 tablespoons Harissa (vary amount depending on your preference)

extendedIngredients.name: red bell pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 red bell pepper, cored and diced

extendedIngredients.name: tomato sauce
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/4 cup tomato sauce (could also use ketchup)

recipes.title: Black Bean Harissa Burgers

winePairing.pairingText: Burger works really well with Malbec, Merlot, and Zinfandel. Merlot will be perfectly adequate for a classic burger with standard toppings. Bolder toppings call for bolder wines, such as a malbec or peppery zinfandel. One wine you could try is Tikal Amorio Malbec. It has 4.2 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 28 dollars.

productMatches.title: Tikal Amorio Malbec
productMatches.description: Aromas of smoky oak and cherry. Mouthwatering, penetrating flavors of ripe red and black cherries, red berries. Quite rich and velvety on the palate, and finishes with just enough grip to make it a real winner with food. This is some seriously sexy Malbec. Pairs well with grilled or smoked meats such as beef, pork, and lamb. Also complements dishes prepared with cheese or cream sauces.

recipes.instructions: Combine water and flax together and allow to thicken while you prepare the rest of the ingredients.Using a food processor (or a fork), process one can of the beans until chunky but not pureed then add it to a large bowl.Next, add the brown rice and green onion to the processor and pulse for about ten seconds, just long enough to slightly chop it then add it to the bowl with the beans.Add the rest of the ingredients to the bowl and mix until well-combined.Using your hands, form the mixture into 10 separate patties and then refrigerate for at least 30 minutes so that they firm up some.When ready to cook, warm the olive oil in a pan over medium heat and sauté for about 5 minutes on each side.Garnish with desired toppings and serve!

steps.step: Combine water and flax together and allow to thicken while you prepare the rest of the ingredients.Using a food processor (or a fork), process one can of the beans until chunky but not pureed then add it to a large bowl.Next, add the brown rice and green onion to the processor and pulse for about ten seconds, just long enough to slightly chop it then add it to the bowl with the beans.

Add the rest of the ingredients to the bowl and mix until well-combined.Using your hands, form the mixture into 10 separate patties and then refrigerate for at least 30 minutes so that they firm up some.When ready to cook, warm the olive oil in a pan over medium heat and sauté for about 5 minutes on each side.
Garnish with desired toppings and serve!
